On 05/01/2008, Derek James <djames@...> wrote:
>
>  1) Try to limit the amount of quoted text in your messages. If
>  advertisements are hanging on the end of long strings of quoted text,
>  this may be causing problems for the spam filter.

I noticed recently that when replying within googlemail the default
editor is a HTML editor which maintains all of the yahoo adverts that
get attacehd to each post. A couple of times recently I didn't notice
this and posted replies with pages of junk on the end because google
mail attempts to collapse quoted text - and thus you don't always
realise now much there is.

Personally I prefer to click the 'Plain Text>>' option when replying
as it allows me to see exactly where all of the junk is and delete it
- but then I've always disliked HTML based editors :)

Colin
